columns.name: organisation_path
columns.dc:title: Organisation Path
columns.schema:description: A sequence of colon separated Organisation Keys that fully specifies the Provider Organisation providing a service to the client.

columns.name: intake_key
columns.dc:title: Intake Key
columns.schema:description: This is a number or code assigned to each intake. The Intake Key is unique and stable for each intake at the level of the organisation.

columns.name: client_key
columns.dc:title: Client Key
columns.schema:description: This is a number or code assigned to each individual client referred to the intake organisation. The client identifier must be unique and stable for each individual within the intake organisation. Assigned by either the PHN or intake organisation depending on local procedures.

columns.name: client_consent
columns.dc:title: Client Consent to Anonymised Data
columns.schema:description: An indication that the client has consented to their anonymised data being provided to the Department of Health for statistical purposes in planning and improving mental health services.

columns.name: referral_date
columns.dc:title: Referral Date
columns.schema:description: The date the referrer made the referral.

columns.name: program_type
columns.dc:title: Program Type
columns.schema:description: The overarching program area that an Intake or Episode record is associated with.

columns.name: referrer_profession
columns.dc:title: Referrer Profession
columns.schema:description: Profession of the provider who referred the client.

columns.name: referrer_organisation_type
columns.dc:title: Referrer Organisation Type
columns.schema:description: Type of organisation in which the referring professional is based.

columns.name: date_client_contacted_intake
columns.dc:title: Date client contacted Intake
columns.schema:description: The date on which the client first contacted the intake service

columns.name: suicide_referral_flag
columns.dc:title: Suicide Referral Flag
columns.schema:description: Identifies those individuals where a recent history of suicide attempt, or suicide risk, was a factor noted in the referral that underpinned the person's needs for assistance at intake or entry to the episode, as represented by a code.

columns.name: date_referred_to_other_service_at_intake_conclusion
columns.dc:title: Date referred to other service at Intake conclusion
columns.schema:description: The date the client was referred to another organisation at Intake conclusion.

columns.name: organisation_type_referred_to_at_intake_conclusion
columns.dc:title: Organisation type referred to at Intake conclusion
columns.schema:description: Type of organisation to which the the client was referred at the Intake conclusion.

columns.name: referred_to_organisation_path
columns.dc:title: Referred to Organisation Path
columns.schema:description: A sequence of colon separated Organisation Keys that fully specifies the Provider Organisation to which the intake referred the client.

columns.name: intake_tags
columns.dc:title: Intake Tags
columns.schema:description: List of tags for the intake.
